intro: Nolana callae, commonly known as the New Zealand starflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Nolana callae is an important part of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in coastal scrub and dune environments.
